--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0294 b) Date of Occurrence: 25/02/2024
c) Installation Details: Minotaur Heavy - AC-8659-499 at
Maintenance Hub-Y
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Armament b) Date Component 05/03/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Fire Control d) Main Assembly: Station-3 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Fire Control Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-B
g) Part No.: AR-7117-P7 h) Sl No.: SN-5309-110
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 16/06/2022 l) Date of Removal: 02/03/2024
Pg No: 5 Ln No: 7 Pg No: 25 Ln No: 1
m) Manufacturing Agency: Pinnacle Aerospace n) Date, Month & Year April 2019
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2339 Hrs / 1070 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Arming circuit safety interlock fault. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Environmental exposure causing accelerated degradation of protective coatings
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fire Control component. Analysis of
operational data indicated parameter deviation.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct detailed inspection of all similar components in fleet
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 30/03/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Eng. T.R. Menon

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type.
Date: 02/04/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 01/04/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable.
Date: 05/04/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 09/04/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
